summary:
Encephalitis is brain inflammation, which can be mild or severe. Symptoms include headaches, fever, confusion, and vomiting. It can cause seizures, memory loss, and hearing issues.

Viruses, bacteria, fungi, or parasites can cause it, or it might be due to autoimmune diseases or medications. Diagnosis involves tests and imaging.

Some types can be prevented with vaccines. Treatment includes medication and sometimes hospitalization and respiration support. Rehabilitation might be needed afterward. Encephalitis affects millions globally each year.
title: Encephalitis
